SecurityTokenParameters Class

In this Article

Specifies an abstract class that when implemented represents security token parameters.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class SecurityTokenParameters

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SecurityTokenParameters

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

Security token parameters provide information about the tokens (for example, token type, issuer, and so on) required by the security binding element.

The security token parameter classes derived from this one are a collection of token properties and methods, and are used in creating different kinds of security binding elements and tokens. Not all of the properties are relevant to all derived classes. For example, the ReferenceStyle has no relevance in an issued token (SAML token) case.

Constructors summary

SecurityTokenParameters()

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenParameters class.
SecurityTokenParameters(SecurityTokenParameters)

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenParameters class from another instance.

Properties summary

HasAsymmetricKey

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token has an asymmetric key.
InclusionMode

Gets or sets the token inclusion requirements.
ReferenceStyle

Gets or sets the token reference style.
RequireDerivedKeys

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether keys can be derived from the original proof keys.
SupportsClientAuthentication

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.
SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.
SupportsServerAuthentication

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.

Methods summary

Clone()

Clones another instance of this instance of the class.
CloneCore()

Clones another instance of this instance of the class.
CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

Creates a key identifier clause for a token.
InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

When overridden in a derived class, initializes a security token requirement.
MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

Indicates whether a token matches a key identifier clause.
ToString()

Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

Constructors

  • SecurityTokenParameters()

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenParameters class.

    protected SecurityTokenParameters ();

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

  • SecurityTokenParameters(SecurityTokenParameters)

    Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenParameters class from another instance.

    protected SecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters other);

    Parameters

    • other
      SecurityTokenParameters

      The other instance of this class.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      other is null.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to the corresponding values in other.

Properties

  • HasAsymmetricKey

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token has an asymmetric key.

    protected abstract bool HasAsymmetricKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token has an asymmetric key; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Asymmetric keys are used in public-key cryptography, which uses two keys, a public key and a private key, which are related mathematically. The public key is distributed widely, but the private key is kept secret. In public-key cryptography, there is no need to exchange a common key.

  • InclusionMode

    Gets or sets the token inclusion requirements.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenInclusionMode InclusionMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenInclusionMode

      The token inclusion requirements.

    Remarks

    The token inclusion requirements specify whether the token needs to be serialized as part of the request and response.

    The SecurityTokenInclusionMode enumeration has the following values:

    • SecurityTokenInclusionMode
    • SecurityTokenInclusionMode
    • SecurityTokenInclusionMode
    • SecurityTokenInclusionMode
  • ReferenceStyle

    Gets or sets the token reference style.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle ReferenceStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

      The reference style for the token.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      An invalid token reference style was set.

    Remarks

    The token reference style specifies how to refer to the token in the SOAP message.

    This property returns a member of an enumeration that sets the desired referencing style that is used to generate security token references (STR) to the security tokens from the signature and encryption elements in the message.

  • RequireDerivedKeys

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether keys can be derived from the original proof keys.

    public bool RequireDerivedKeys { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if keys need to be derived from the token's key; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    WCF needs to derive keys from the token's key when performing signature and encryption using the token.

    Derived keys originate in Secure Conversations where there is a shared security context so that the same security can be applied across all messages in the conversation. A security context token involves a shared secret, which is used for message signing and encryption. The shared secret is used to create derived keys. To maintain a high level of security through a lengthy conversation, new derived keys can be created periodically.

  • SupportsClientAuthentication

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.

    protected abstract bool SupportsClientAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports client authentication; otherwise, false.

  • SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.

    protected abstract bool SupportsClientWindowsIdentity { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports a Windows identity for authentication; otherwise, false.

  • SupportsServerAuthentication

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.

    protected abstract bool SupportsServerAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports server authentication; otherwise, false.

Methods

  • Clone()

    Clones another instance of this instance of the class.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters Clone ();

    Returns

    • SecurityTokenParameters

      A copy of SecurityTokenParameters instance.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      Unable to clone this instance of the class.

    Remarks

    The Clone and CloneCore methods follow the Core design pattern. In that pattern, this method performs some validation and then calls CloneCore, which is an abstract method that is overridden in derived classes to perform the core functionality.

  • CloneCore()

    Clones another instance of this instance of the class.

    protected abstract System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters CloneCore ();

    Returns

    • SecurityTokenParameters

      A SecurityTokenParameters instance that represents the copy.

    Remarks

    The Clone and CloneCore methods follow the Core design pattern. CloneCore is an abstract method that is overridden in derived classes.

  • CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

    Creates a key identifier clause for a token.

    protected abstract System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause CreateKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle referenceStyle);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token.

    • referenceStyle
      SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

      The reference style of the security token.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The key identifier clause for a token.

    Remarks

    This method must be implemented in a derived class.

  • InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

    When overridden in a derived class, initializes a security token requirement.

    protected abstract void InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement requirement);

    Parameters

    • requirement
      SecurityTokenRequirement

      The requirement of the security token.

    Remarks

    The token requirement is provided as input to the security token manager to obtain a security token provider or security token authenticator for the token.

  • MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

    Indicates whether a token matches a key identifier clause.

    protected virtual bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle referenceStyle);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The security token.

    • keyIdentifierClause
      SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The specified key identifier clause.

    • referenceStyle
      SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

      The reference style of the security token.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the token matches the key identifier clause; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

    • NotSupportedException

      referenceStyle is not SecurityTokenReferenceStyle or SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

  • ToString()

    Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A text representation of this instance of the class.

    Remarks

    The method displays the name of this class, InclusionMode, ReferenceStyle, and RequireDerivedKeys.
